        <div class="grid-container" id="main-content">
                            <div class="grid-x grid-margin-x">
    <div class="small-12 medium-12 large-9 cell">

Top notes are Gardenia, Carnation and Jasmine; middle notes are Patchouli, Flowers, Sandalwood and Sea Notes; base notes are Caramel and Coffee. </p><p class="reviewstrigger" style="font-size:                             <div class="cell small-12" style="display: inline-flex; margin: 0.4rem;word-wrap: break-word;padding: 0 0.6rem 0 0.6rem;">
                    <div class="fa-lg" style="display: flex; align-items: center; color: grey; cursor: pointer;">
                    <div style="display: inline-flex;">

                        </div>
                    </div>
                    </div>
                    Floral and gourmand notes compete for attention
                </div>
                            <div class="cell small-12" style="display: inline-flex; margin: 0.4rem;word-wrap: break-word;padding: 0 0.6rem 0 0.6rem;">

                            <span>
                            <i class="far fa-thumbs-up"></i>

                    May have a slight b.o. or dusty funk flavor to some noses
                </div>

<div class="newslist cell small-12 large-6">
    <img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/news/en/12850/news.12850-120x120.jpg" alt="Bond No 9 Holiday Collection" style="margin-right: 1em; flex-shrink: 0">    <div class="flex-child-auto">

            <span class="clickcatcher"></span><h4>Bond No 9 Holiday Collection</h4>
        </a>
        <p>by <i>Sandra Raievi Petrovi</i></p>
        <div class="right-bottom-corner-abs">            10/17/19 09:55
                    </div>
    </div>

    <span class="badge">6</span>
</div>
<div class="newslist cell small-12 large-6">
    <img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/news/en/10114/news.10114-120x120.jpg" alt="Bond No 9 - Novelties and Holiday Editions Presented at TFWA 2017, Cannes" style="margin-right: 1em; flex-shrink: 0">    <div class="flex-child-auto">
        <a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/news/Bond-No-9-Novelties-and-Holiday-Editions-Presented-at-TFWA-2017-Cannes-10114.html">
            <span class="clickcatcher"></span><h4>Bond No 9 - Novelties and Holiday Editions Presented at TFWA 2017, Cannes</h4>
        </a>
        <p>by <i>Sandra Raievi Petrovi</i></p>
        <div class="right-bottom-corner-abs">            10/24/17 09:51
                    </div>
    </div>

    <span class="badge">0</span>
</div>
</div></div><div class="cell small-12 medium-6" style="padding: 2rem 1.5rem 0 1.5rem;"><longevity-rating :perfume_id="46057"><p style="color: #83a6c4;">Perfume longevity:<span>3.45</span> out of<span>5</span>.</p></longevity-rating></div><div class="cell small-12 medium-6" style="padding: 2rem 1.5rem 0 1.5rem;"><sillage-rating :perfume_id="46057"><p style="color: #83a6c4;">Perfume sillage:<span>2.31</span> out of<span>4</span>.</p></sillage-rating></div><!-- Tag ID: fragranticacom_perfume_incontent_4 -->

<div class="freeStarFragrantica" align="center" data-freestar-ad="__300x300" id="fragranticacom_perfume_incontent_5" v-pre>
</div></div><div class="cell small-12"><ul class="tabs" data-deep-link="true" data-update-history="true" data-deep-link-smudge="true" data-deep-link-smudge-delay="500" data-tabs id="deeplinked-tabs"><li class="tabs-title is-active"><a href="#all-reviews" aria-selected="true"><svg class="menu" style="width: 1rem; height: 1rem;display: inline-block" fill="currentColor" viewBox="0 0 20 20" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M10 18a8 8 0 100-16 8 8 0 000 16zm1-12a1 1 0 10-2 0v4a1 1 0 00.293.707l2.828 2.829a1 1 0 101.415-1.415L11 9.586V6z"clip-rule="evenodd"></path></svg>All reviews by date</a></li><li class="tabs-title"><a href="#popular-positive-reviews"><svg class="menu hide-for-medium" style="width: 1rem; height: 1rem;display: inline-block" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" viewBox="0 0 24 24" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><path stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round" stroke-width="2" d="M7 8h10M7 12h4m1 8l-4-4H5a2 2 0 01-2-2V6a2 2 0 012-2h14a2 2 0 012 2v8a2 2 0 01-2 2h-3l-4 4z"></path></svg><like style="width: 1rem; height: 1rem;"></like><span class="show-for-medium">Positive Reviews</span></a></li><li class="tabs-title"><a href="#popular-negative-reviews"><svg class="menu hide-for-medium" style="width: 1rem; height: 1rem;display: inline-block" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" viewBox="0 0 24 24" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><path stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round" stroke-width="2" d="M7 8h10M7 12h4m1 8l-4-4H5a2 2 0 01-2-2V6a2 2 0 012-2h14a2 2 0 012 2v8a2 2 0 01-2 2h-3l-4 4z"></path></svg><dislike style="width: 1rem; height: 1rem;"></dislike><span class="show-for-medium">Negative Reviews</span></a></li><li class="tabs-title"><a href="#search-reviews"><svg class="menu hide-for-medium" style="width: 1rem; height: 1rem;display: inline-block" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" viewBox="0 0 24 24" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><path stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round" stroke-width="2" d="M7 8h10M7 12h4m1 8l-4-4H5a2 2 0 01-2-2V6a2 2 0 012-2h14a2 2 0 012 2v8a2 2 0 01-2 2h-3l-4 4z"></path></svg><i class="fas fa-search"></i><span class="show-for-medium">Search</span></a></li></ul><reviews-wrapper><div class="tabs-content" data-tabs-content="deeplinked-tabs"><div class="tabs-panel is-active" id="all-reviews"><div class="cell">
    <div class="strike-title"><span>All Reviews By Date</span></div>
    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">
        <div class="cell destinationreview"></div>                    <div id="parent2368926" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2368926" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="AustinFerencz"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1980178"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="AustinFerencz" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Nishane/Wulong-Cha-30567.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.30567.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Wulng Ch"title="Wulng Ch"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2368926ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2368926" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1980178">AustinFerencz</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-12-02">12/02/24 21:56</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Caramel and Coffee From start to finish (I can understand the banana when thinking about it) in the best way with slight florals in the front. This is one of my favorite fragrances I've ever smelled in every aspect perfect to me, gourmand but not so sweet that it is offputing. It is a perfect wintertime fragrance that receives compliments more than any other sample I have ever drained. I wore this through an airport before and received many compliments, and the whole experience was enjoyable. I know some people call this the Fanum cologne, but it's so much more than that, and it has been known in the fragrance world since before. This fragrance reminds me of fond memories of winter and fall, along with big, active cities in the night lights. The cool bottle will be an added bonus to an already astounding fragrance. This isn't even needed to sample to buy for a good deal. In my opinion, it is blind-buy worthy and a fragrance that you will love and that everyone around you will love while wearing it. Smelling this in the air lifts my spirits and makes me feel warm and comfortable. If you are interested in winter/fall or gourmand fragrances, this is a must smell. <br />
Scent: 10/10<br />
Longevity: 8/10<br />
Projection: 7/10<br />
Price: 8/10 $160 for 100ml on discounters (tester), and I think this is reasonable for such a great fragrance (Do NOT buy retail)<br />
Final Rating: 10/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="2368926"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=2368926#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2363185" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2363185" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="divineintervation1994"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2280215"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2280215.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="divineintervation1994" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jean-Paul-Gaultier/Scandal-Pour-Homme-Le-Parfum-74915.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.74915.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Scandal Pour Homme Le Parfum"title="Scandal Pour Homme Le Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2363185ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2363185" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2280215">divineintervation1994</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-11-27">11/27/24 12:44</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>That Carnation in the notes really made me freak out but I do not get it at all. The comments are right, this kinda smells like banana. I think it is caused by the coffee-caramel-patchouli-marine combo but I quite like it. I do not think it interesting for me to enough to buy a bottle (not a big fan of gourmands, especially if the price is too high.) but I do not think there will be many fan of gourmand fragrances that dislikes this.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2354103" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="PhonePotato"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1224212"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1224212.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="PhonePotato" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Aaron-Terence-Hughes/Supernova-90884.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.90884.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Supernova"title="Supernova"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2354103ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2354103" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1224212">PhonePotato</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-11-19">11/19/24 07:12</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I like it but its a kinda boring and too linear on its own, good for layering though.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="2354103"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=2354103#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2350775" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2350775" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="BowTieBeau"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2205713"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2205713.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="BowTieBeau" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2350775ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2350775" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2205713">BowTieBeau</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-11-16">11/16/24 05:25</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Such a polarizing scent to me. My mind says disgusting, but my body says nonpareil. Although I threw away the tester strip I had for this relatively quickly, I still smelled it almost a hundred times over to make up what this smelled like to me.<br />
New York Nights is, to me, an absolute masterpiece of a gourmand fragrance. There is a weird, yet pleasing amalgamation of caramel, coffee, and an unlisted note of banana that makes this exciting, delicious and passionate in a beautiful and never-before seen way. This is one of the few fragrances with an exorbinant pricetag that I have been considering saving up for, because it absolutely awestruck me the first time I smelled it in an almost-intimate way. I do not detect any marine in this like others are saying, but instead just a sweet, gourmand paragon with a depth that I've never seen in such a fragrance before.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="2350775"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=2350775#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.71); padding: 0; border: none; margin: 0;"><!-- Tag ID: fragranticacom_perfume_incontent_6 -->
<div class="freeStarFragrantica" align="center" data-freestar-ad="__300x300" id="fragranticacom_perfume_incontent_6" v-pre>
</div></div><div id="parent2342711" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2342711" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Dacsz"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2281718"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2281718.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Dacsz" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2342711ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2342711" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2281718">Dacsz</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-11-08">11/08/24 20:54</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This fragrance does not smell like you think it would. It has a sweet element to it, but the marinw notes, coffee and florals are fantastic. It is sweet but not really. It is fresh but not really. It really nails the perfect balance point between them with a coffee note in the background to bring everything together in lovely fashion.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="2342711"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=2342711#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2327731" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2327731" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="evan13gray"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2100569"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="evan13gray" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2327731ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2327731" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2100569">evan13gray</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-25">10/25/24 18:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>9.3/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="2327731"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=2327731#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2317914" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2317914" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="brlp"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1836525"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="brlp" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Mancera/Amore-Caffe-87409.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.87409.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Amore Caff"title="Amore Caff"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2317914ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2317914" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1836525">brlp</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-16">10/16/24 14:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Judging by the notes I expected a deep gourmand scent (and all the comparisons to tero, which I love). However like lots of ppl said, this smells like banana for some reason. Its really floral and its not deep at all, almost smells cheap. Pass.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="2317914"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=2317914#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2315761" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2315761" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="frankcoelho"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1712325"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1712325.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="frankcoelho" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Loumari/Porthole-83054.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.83054.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Porthole"title="Porthole"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2315761ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2315761" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1712325">frankcoelho</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-14">10/14/24 15:02</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I was initially hesitant to agree with the comparison with Tero, by Nishane, but in terms of the smell itself, it is the thing it smells the closest to that I've come across.<br />
Now, I HATE Tero, and this was very much a LIKE.<br />
<br />
Let me begin with the drydown and I'll build it from the opening again below it: I agree with @sharuko and do pick up the sweet sweat! Sweaty folk wearing Axe Dark Temptation kind of vibe. Anyways... here is the rest of the review.<br />
<br />
Smells like hot breakfast with fresh baked banana bread-like goods. Sweet and slightly spicy with a light coffee aroma lingering .<br />
The flowers do take over its development and it never gets overly sweet but rather delicious/food-like. The one thing I hate in Tero this has much more balanced, and it is performance. Tero is absurdly strong of my skin, never stops projecting, and cloys the heck out of everything/everywhere. This follows you and may get into people's noses, but in a pleasant and quite inoffensive way. Cozy and warm for transitional times of the year as well as cold times.<br />
<br />
This is a stay at home kind of fragrance and really isn't an attention grabber. Discrete but alluring, still think it's quite overpriced. Also, this is a 50ml fragrance for me, as I'd never go through 100ml - still, wouldn't pick it up due to how situational at it is, along with not being one I'd wear for its situations.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="2315761"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=2315761#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2312392" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; I find bond no.9 use of white florals makes some unisex fragrances come off feminine in the openings. I have the same experience with Greenwich Village.<br />
.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="2258290"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=2258290#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2253855" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2253855" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="&gt;Happy Cat&lt;"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1191490"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1191490.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="&gt;Happy Cat&lt;" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Giorgio-Armani/Magenta-Tanzanite-71536.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.71536.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Magenta Tanzanite"title="Magenta Tanzanite"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2253855ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2253855" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.79); It smells like mens cologne. Sea water at the top, carnation, patchouli, caramel providing sweetness in the background. It would be nice for a man but I hate to wear it myself.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="2253855"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=2253855#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2253478" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2253478" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="kayleeperfumery"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2029746"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2029746.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="kayleeperfumery" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2253478ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2253478" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2029746">kayleeperfumery</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-18">08/18/24 14:09</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I have been intoxicated by this scent ever since I first sampled it in bloomingdales. It was definitely love at first sniff for me and I knew I needed a full bottle. Its bold and unique. Sexy for men and women. Gourmand but not overdone. Sweet and spicy in the best way with a small aquatic and floral touch in the dry down that somehow just works. This to me is a 10/10 fragrance.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="2253478"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=2253478#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2239638" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="2233780"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=2233780#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2228593" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:4,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2228593" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="A-Minor"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2171240"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2171240.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="A-Minor" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2228593ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2228593" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2171240">A-Minor</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-24">07/24/24 21:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>FANUM COLOGNE </p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="2228593"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=2228593#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2225719" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2225719" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Turbojet4458"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2095521"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2095521.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Turbojet4458" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Al-Haramain-Perfumes/Detour-Noir-70748.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.70748.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Dtour Noir"title="Dtour Noir"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2225719ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2225719" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2095521">Turbojet4458</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-21">07/21/24 23:11</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Fanum cologne.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="2225719"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=2225719#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2224972" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2224972" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Hautechic"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1659624"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Hautechic" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.54157.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Greenwich Village"title="Greenwich Village"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2224972ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2224972" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1659624">Hautechic</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-21">07/21/24 00:44</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Edit 07/24/2024:<br />
This fragrance has taken me for a RIDE! Everything I thought I knew and felt about it below has changed completely. All of a sudden a flip was switched and I now 100% get the banana smell! Its like banana candy with a light airy caramel (not sticky and thick). I dont really smell too much coffee but there is a faint smokiness that is barely there. This has now REALLY grown on me now but Im so so so confused. It has completely changed compared to what I smelled the first few days I smelled it. I no longer get much patchouli, whereas it was so dominant before. This scent was eternal on me and it seemed impossible to wash off too now it seems to only last a few hours. What is happening? Why is it that only the smells we dont like seem to last forever? Is it just me? What a wild ride! The good news is I now love this scent and will be wearing it much more, especially in the fall. Bond No 9 is quickly becoming one of my favourite fragrance houses. This is the most unique scent Ive ever owned.<br />
<br />
I just recently got into Bond No 9 fragrances and started with Greenwich Village which I fell in love with and then moved on to Tribeca which I am absolutely obsessed with. New York Nights came after and after hearing about how gourmand it is with notes of caramel and coffee, I knew I had to have it. I was quite disappointed when I received it cause it smelled nothing like what I expected. I dont smell any coffee or banana candy or gourmand notes. To me, this is heavy spicy patchouli with a background of caramel. Ive been struggling with it because I smell something so different than what everyone else smells and it almost leans more masculine for me which is why I have been having a hard time. I got the idea recently to layer Lattafas Eclaire (which is a dupe for Bianca Latte) with NYN to make it a lot more gourmand and sweet so that it leans much more feminine for me while making the scent much more deep and interesting. This combination really brings out the caramel note so that it is more what I was hoping for. I highly recommend it! This combo is a huge love for me! I hope I can still grow to love NYN on its own so I dont feel so bad about how expensive it is.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="2224972"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=2224972#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2217067" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2217067" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="hokeypokeyguy"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1903875"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="hokeypokeyguy" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jean-Paul-Gaultier/Scandal-Pour-Homme-68074.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.68074.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Scandal Pour Homme"title="Scandal Pour Homme"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2217067ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2217067" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.9); <br />
It has a soft gourmand profile that makes your significant other want to lean in close. Ppl have this marked as it can only be worn in the Winter, but I beg to differ as this could be worn year-round. Beautifully composed, unisex not too feminine and not too masculine. <br />
<br />
Honestly if a female wore this, I would know that she knows her stuff when it comes to scents. <br />
<br />
~ mAKES Too mUch $cents ~</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="2208591"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=2208591#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2207851" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; From memory of what NYN smelled like, the clone is pretty spot on in terms of the smell. It's a tad bit synthetic like nail polish remover but only for a minute but maybe that's just because my bottle was super hot from sitting in the mailbox. padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1269799">Goso2160</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-20">06/20/24 14:33</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>For those not wanting to spend serious money (like me) get Jo Milano game of spades moon. Freaking awesome dupe of New York nights and last at least 9 hours on me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="2194498"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=2194498#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2193964" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2193964" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Skellyt"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1761303"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1761303.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Skellyt" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Guerlain/Angelique-Noire-1021.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1021.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Anglique Noire"title="Anglique Noire"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2193964ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2193964" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1761303">Skellyt</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-20">06/20/24 05:00</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>One of the only gourmand fragrances with decent longevity I can tolerate and appreciate. It is light and creamy. As @theexperience said below, the combination of notes gives an illusory banana smell. However, theres no mistaking it, the caramel is the biggest player in this fragrance and its not overly heavy. It is not straight up banana bread. This smells amazing in the air and on my skin and I think it is highly underrated. I dont like Bond No. 9 much as a brand but this one is full bottle worthy for me. Alsothis fragrance is unique. No one you know is going to have it. Gatekeep as you wish :)<br />
<br />
Ok, with that said, there is one major problem with this fragranceas much as I love it, it is MASSIVELY overpriced for what it is. I got it for $187 on MaxAroma and I still feel like even that is overpriced. But at this level of niche, price isnt typically the main point of discussion. People will still buy this at full price.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="2193964"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=2193964#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2193909" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="2150858"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=2150858#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2150852" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2150852" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="kipsu"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1564859"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1564859.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="kipsu" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Prada/Luna-Rossa-Black-48682.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.48682.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Luna Rossa Black"title="Luna Rossa Black"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2150852ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2150852" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1564859">kipsu</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-09">05/09/24 13:49</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Man I love this. Blind bought it off Notino, and it's one of those that I could easily end up buying more off.<br />
My only downsides to this, as well as my Bleecker Street, is that the caps are very bad, doesn't fit tight around the bottle or anything, feels cheap. As do the boxes.<br />
Atomizer is okay, little leaking but pretty average.<br />
This smells like a sweet, caramel-ish slice of banana pie. Very gourmand-like, which I enjoy.<br />
May be a bit too sweet for some, but I personally love this, it's in my current Top 5, and I own 70 fragrances which says a lot.<br />
It is an easy scent to go nose blind to, but I absoloutely disagree in it being a marine-like or salt-water smell.<br />
Scent: 9/10<br />
Projection: 8/10, not too strong, just right. Most sweet scents tend to be very strong in projection<br />
Longevity: 8/10, respectably long<br />
Price pr ml: 2/10, Bond is a very expensive house, and for the quality of the bottles and packaging, for most people this wouldn't be a reccommendation from me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; Hope I will get the caramel and banana vibes soon. To my nose it is absolutely not gourmand.<br />
The swamp marine note makes it aquatic, in the way that it reminds me of JPG Divine.<br />
The sprayer sprays like a childs watergun, no mist, no cloud, just a thin attack.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="2148277"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=2148277#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2148121" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2139022" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Thealyn"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1822717"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Thealyn" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2139022ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2139022" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1822717">Thealyn</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-28">04/28/24 09:56</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>For me, the first thing out of this bottle is patchouli, like pure patchouli essential oil. Right behind it is nail polish. Eventually I could detect the sea notes. It only became a little bit sweet to my nose. Just wondering where that banana bread is...I feel so left out! <br />
Anyway, it's a confusing jumble of notes that doesn't add up to a great gourmand to me, not even close.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="2139022"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=2139022#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2128713" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2128713" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Jackw9"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2036035"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Jackw9" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/Grand-Soir-40816.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.40816.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Grand Soir"title="Grand Soir"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2128713ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2128713" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2036035">Jackw9</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-18">04/18/24 13:55</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It smells like freshly baked banana bread. best for winter and fall but can also be worn on colder spring days. If you can find this for under $200, definitely pick it up. One of the best gourmands.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="2128713"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=2128713#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2125145" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="2106157"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=2106157#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2102607" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2102607" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Exentric_Smells"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1975816"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1975816.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Exentric_Smells" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2102607ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2102607" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1975816">Exentric_Smells</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-24">03/24/24 08:54</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I'd say its overpriced for retail $470 for a bottle but if you can pick it up for under 250 than its a perfect deal for what it is. Its a very realistic gourmand and doesnt feel too overpowering, yet it has a thickness to it that makes it edible. Its not nauseatingly sweet to the point where it gives me a headache, and I'd say people who arent a fan of gourmands will probably like this one as its not super synthetic or overpowering. Longevity lasts around 9-10 hours with 3 feet projection which is fair. Now the smell itself on the opening is much of a banana bread type smell, and the drydown shows the perfected caramel and coffee notes that bring out the best of this fragrance. Bond no. 9 is a very interesting and unique house that can be appreciated with time</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="2102607"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=2102607#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2102450" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2102450" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="sorachii_"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2004024"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2004024.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="sorachii_" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2102450ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2102450" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.83); I hate the smell of bananas, so this is terrible for me. The pyramid of scent notes are far more interesting than what was actually made.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="2102450"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=2102450#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2101222" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2101222" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="SmellGood_Chi"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1999067"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="SmellGood_Chi" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Bond-No-9/TriBeCa-59904.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.59904.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="TriBeCa"title="TriBeCa"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2101222ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2101222" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1999067">SmellGood_Chi</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-22">03/22/24 20:21</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Jomashop had a VERY nice sale on this (less than $200 for 100 ml) so I finally decided to buy it. The opening, frankly, is underwhelming. I was worried. Then it dries into this incredible mix of caramel and banana bread with a healthy sprinkle of white floral and a finish that's a whiff of the sea. And it is beautiful! So well balanced. Labeled as unisex but is sweet enough to lean more feminine to me. Sillage is moderate but quite long-lasting. On me, a solid 8-9 hours on the skin--long enough to carry you from the office through a date night. Some say this is best saved for evening; I disagree. Day or night and in any season, spray her! So far, my fave from Bond No. 9.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="2101222"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=2101222#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2099663" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/910784">Androgynous</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-21">03/21/24 11:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>smell so smooth and delicious</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="2099663"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=2099663#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2097048" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2097048" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="MSita"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1736174"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="MSita" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2097048ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2097048" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1736174">MSita</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-19">03/19/24 03:17</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I never expected it to smell this good based on the notes. I couldn't decide what to expect, but surprisingly, it's thick and sweet without being too overpowering, at least not to me. I really like it, and I wish it were a bit stronger.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="2097048"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=2097048#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2095019" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2095019" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Frag10"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2060636"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2060636.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Frag10" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2095019ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2095019" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2060636">Frag10</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-17">03/17/24 01:16</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I do not live in an area where I can smell non-designer scents. (I had already smelled every designer scent in Macy's 5 times) However, I visited a Bloomingdale in a big city near me, and to my surprise, I saw a lot of the more popular niche fragrance brands. I immediately started searching for fresh scents I had not smelled yet as I need a summer fragrance. PDM Sedley was a cologne I really enjoyed. Then, I saw the Bond No. 9 table. Not thinking much of it, I went to go smell each one, grabbing for the ones that look more fresh and citric. I picked up New York Lights, sprayed it on my arm, smelled it, and I knew immediately I needed it. I could not stop smelling it. I did not care that it wasn't a summer time fragrance. I felt as if colognes and perfumes were ruined because they were not New York Lights. Seriously the best scent I have ever smelled.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="2095019"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=2095019#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2090809" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
