Theyre real and theyre in this bottle.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="2090809"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=2090809#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2089103" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2089103" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Roses1357"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1319042"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Roses1357" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2089103ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2089103" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1319042">Roses1357</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-11">03/11/24 09:34</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>At first, I thought this pulled a little masculine leaning on me, especially in the dry down, but now I completely get the banana nut bread aroma for the majority of the time, and it is so addicting. Not too sweet.  Not doughy. Aromatic. It lasts forever on me and my clothes.  Usually when there is even a hint of banana in fragrances, it repulses me, but this is done so well and doesnt portray an overripe or overly green scent. Maybe because banana wasnt the intended goal? Or was it?. Makes me want to bake, eat, and swim in banana caramel sauce.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="2089103"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=2089103#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2078863" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2078863" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="CynicalPink"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1924789"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1924789.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="CynicalPink" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Commodity/Book-50618.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.50618.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Book"title="Book"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2078863ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2078863" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1924789">CynicalPink</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-01">03/01/24 07:22</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I purchased a sample after reading all the reviews that mentioned banana, and maybe it came from a bad batch? Or my nose is blind to a lot of the notes? <br />
<br />
No banana for me, only some light florals layered over (a nice) caramel. My chemistry also pulls coffee, which is great, because Ive been wanting a coffee scent and Black Opium somehow smells like grapes and Garnier on me.<br />
<br />
Overall, a smooth gourmand thats true to the notes listed by Bond and Fragrantica, but Im disappointed that Im not experiencing this scent in the same way as others.<br />
<br />
Seems more intimate than moderate. Sadly only lasted about three hours on my skin, even when pressing my nose close. As it stands, I might go for a decant or travel size if I could find a good bargain, but a FB feels overpriced.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="2078863"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=2078863#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2076154" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Very unique scent profile so if you have the money and you want to get compliments, buy this</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="2076154"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=2076154#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2070169" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2060017" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Miracle.Fragrance"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1369006"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1369006.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Miracle.Fragrance" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2060017ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2060017" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1369006">Miracle.Fragrance</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-12">02/12/24 09:18</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is the best gourmand perfume from Bond No. 9, sweet fruity like the smell of bananas.<br />
but unfortunately the price is still too expensive.<br />
If one day I get a discount, maybe I will buy this perfume.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="2060017"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=2060017#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2053992" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Gourmand without being too in your face, light enough for general wear but just dark enough for night time wear too. Very pricey though, I dont think I could ever be tempted to drop that amount of money on it even though I love it. If you do want to get it at a discount then Notino is probably your best shout, as discounted I definitely think its worth it! <br />
<br />
Scent: 10/10<br />
Projection: 8/10<br />
Longevity: 8/10<br />
Versatility: 7/10<br />
Price (at full price): 5/10<br />
<br />
Overall: 7.6/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="2045869"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=2045869#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2045083" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; I felt this fragrances caramel note was way too heavy and sweet, it gave me a headache after I applied it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="2037951"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=2037951#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2025478" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1958212">circasurvivee</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-09">01/09/24 09:21</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>i dont really get banana in this like everyone else seems to be getting but i get a fair amount of that kind of sweetness, really nice caramel. not a super strong smell and not sickly, as refreshing as a sweet perfume could be. it smells like warm pastries and gelato on a warm night out in the city, like blueberries all melted and gooey stuck to a pan. just a marvellous smell. i blind bought this and am so in love, zero regrets even though this is faaar out of my usual taste in perfumes but i tend to be very open, i love the smell of bakeries and fruits and melting sugar. no florals come through for me which is a blessing. this is a special perfume. you can almost feel sticky caramel and berries in your mouth and on your fingers when you smell this. berries feature rather prominently for me surprisingly enough. im not sure why the way im smelling this is so different to all the other reviews! so much happier with the way it plays on my skin specifically though.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="2025478"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=2025478#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2015204" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2015204" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Misha424"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1496501"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Misha424" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2015204ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2015204" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1496501">Misha424</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-30">12/30/23 09:44</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>For a scent that has no banana note, all I get is banana &amp; caramel lol. I love this scent. Definitely unisex but also very gourmand. I dont like most of the Bond scents because they are pretty floral but this &amp; MyTribeca are the kind of scents I love. It is very sweet &amp; yummy. If you dont like really sweet scents then avoid this one. I dont think this is blind buy safe. Though I love it, I can see why some wouldnt. It is a very interesting scent &amp; I dont have anything else like it. I went all out and got the body cream when I got the perfume. I wear it with a caramel oil or birthday cake body glaze and its fire! This perfume is expensive but I feel like its worth it because the scent is intoxicating! Its a love! Perfumy banana cake. Its as yummy as it sounds! This shines in the colder weather so in Michigan weather its great. I could see it being cloying in the summer - its a heavier scent meant to swirl in the wind. Id wear this day or night in the cold weather.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="2015204"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=2015204#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2013813" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2013813" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Whateverwhocares"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1757007"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1757007.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Whateverwhocares" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2013813ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2013813" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1757007">Whateverwhocares</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-28">12/28/23 23:39</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Unexpectedly candied. Smells like a banana Laffy Taffy, flowers and toffee hard candy. Cloying, to the point that it's unpleasant. <br />
<br />
An interesting scent that strays from expectations. Unisex with a strong, feminine lean. Synthetic gum extract vibes.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="2013813"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=2013813#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2009231" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2009231" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="lautre"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1284528"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1284528.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="lautre" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2009231ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2009231" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1284528">lautre</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-23">12/23/23 20:34</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>When I tried this fragrance the first time, I disliked it very much because it was too masculine and nauseating. However, when I tried this again in December when the temperature was getting colder, I immediately fell in love with this scent. It is narcotic and intoxicating sweet caramel with some dense floral reminding me of banana pudding. I think there is some similarity with Ylang in Gold by M. Micallef, however, this is more mature, sweeter, less floral, and more unisex in my opinion. Unfortunately, the price is insanely crazy, however, it has extraordinary vibes. Whenever I wear this scent, it makes me wanna visit New York. I also love the bottle design, which is a dreamy New York night that we imagine and expect what New York should be.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="2009231"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=2009231#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2008579" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; <br />
It is a like for me, but for a patchoulli fan this could be an easy love.<br />

I was curious about TriBeCa, but I don't think Bond No. 9 is the house for me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="2003070"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=2003070#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2001544" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2001544" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ambervxyjul"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1598318"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1598318.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ambervxyjul" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2001544ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2001544" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1598318">ambervxyjul</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-14">12/14/23 20:00</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is an interesting one. Not what I expected just by reading notes. It has this nail polish scent in the beginning but thankfully that goes away. I get almost a sourness from something as well I cant put my finger on. Its unique, not a safe blind buy for sure. Its dried down completely and I smell the caramel and coffee mixed with florals. I like the dry down more than the opening! Didnt last too long on my skin (4 1/2 hours) so Im glad I sampled it!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="2001544"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=2001544#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1998605" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1998605" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Ckita07"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1722294"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1722294.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Ckita07" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maison-Violet/Un-Air-d-Apogee-48516.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.48516.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Un Air dApoge"title="Un Air dApoge"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1998605ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1998605" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1722294">Ckita07</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-11">12/11/23 12:23</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I bought a decant through Etsy and was sure there must have been a mix-up and that perhaps they sent me Ylang in Gold by accident. I was expected a darker caramel/coffee scent. Instead I am getting powdery, sweet, light yellow and white florals with a creamy vanilla. I love this scent profile so I'm not mad about it, but definitely be aware and don't blind buy this!!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="1998605"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=1998605#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1991516" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Lol Im far from a hater, but this perfume fragrance is ok. <br />
<br />
I do love the banana caramel note that I am smelling, however the polish scent is whats throwing my nose off just a little. <br />
<br />
Test before purchasing! Thats wisdom because this fragrance is pricy for those on a financial budget. padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1959320" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="chavant"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1873052"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1873052.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="chavant" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Anna-Sui/Fantasia-Pop-Surprise-79875.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.79875.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Fantasia Pop Surprise"title="Fantasia Pop Surprise"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1959320ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1959320" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1873052">chavant</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-23">10/23/23 19:14</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>On my skin it smells like pink bubblegum, but in a really refined way, especially on dry down. I personally love it! If you wanted to like Sundered by Byredo, but were put off by musk and neroli heaviness, try this!  <br />
<br />
The caramel mixing with other notes registers a little different on everyone, but on my skin it smells similar to when you open a disk of hubba bubba bubbletape! </p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="1959320"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=1959320#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1955510" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1955510" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="deaccs"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1730960"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1730960.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="deaccs" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Nishane/Hundred-Silent-Ways-37602.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.37602.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Hundred Silent Ways"title="Hundred Silent Ways"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1955510ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1955510" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1730960">deaccs</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-18">10/18/23 19:43</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I actually think this fragrance is more interesting than many people give it credit for; its not necessarily a classic linear gourmand as some have said. While this fragrance is undeniably sweet and feminine, something about it is very intriguing. Not necessarily a safe blind buy but likely mass appealing nonetheless.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="1955510"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=1955510#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1947227" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1947227" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="dcjimr"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1186069"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1186069.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="dcjimr" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1947227ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1947227" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1186069">dcjimr</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-08">10/08/23 13:40</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I would swear there is ylang in here, although there is none listed.  I like this a lot, but to me it is not a straightforward gourmand (thankfully).  I smell some sweet ambery florals with patchouli.  I'd love to have this.  EDIT:  bought a bottle and loving it!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="1947227"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=1947227#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1945936" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1945936" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="quithach"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1843154"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1843154.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="quithach" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dolce-Gabbana/The-One-for-Men-Eau-de-Parfum-31909.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.31909.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="The One for Men Eau de Parfum"title="The One for Men Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1945936ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1945936" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1843154">quithach</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-06">10/06/23 18:58</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Not a big fan of most niche fragrances but this one is pretty good. Sweet and easy on the nose. Smells like salted caramel or banana. Yummy.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="1945936"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=1945936#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1921300" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1399561">jayariz</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-09-06">09/06/23 12:28</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I'm still trying to condense my thoughts into a simple description. It's gourmandy territory, like melted toffee or caramel but, the one I'm still trying to figure out, is the main backbone of the fragrance- what I constantly smell.<br />
<br />
It feels like this old newspapery, dusty filing cabinet that also has a pair of your grandpa's trousers which have sat there for an eternity.<br />
<br />
It's not necessarily bad, but that's just what I'm getting.<br />
<br />
I don't hate it and will try wearing it more in different weather but for now...<br />
<br />
Toffee and old cabinets, for now.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="1921300"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=1921300#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1914925" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Very strong, banging sillage.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="1914925"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=1914925#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1913318" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1473695">HMY</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-28">08/28/23 04:37</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I so wanted to like this one but on me it smells like nail polish. Seriously, I put it on myself and was like wtf is this? After some time of dry down I can detect some ylang yalng and dry down is citrusy, musky but I can still smell the nail polish. Unfortunately, pass for me. I am still lookin for my banana perfume. There are so little perfumes with true banana scent.<br />
P.S. perfume performs differently on each skin, this is subjective review</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="1913318"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=1913318#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1912322" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1912322" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Benjamin111"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1823605"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Benjamin111" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1912322ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1912322" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1823605">Benjamin111</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-26">08/26/23 18:59</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>New York Nights is an amazing and smooth Carmel/Sandlewood fragrance. A truly delectable and gourmand scent. At the same time it subtly gives me hotel lobby type smell, in a good way. I wear this sparingly only because it is that good. This could easily be added to anyones top 5 cologne collection. <br />
<br />
This is a splendid unisex fragrance. I had my female friend blindly smell multiple fragrance I have and this was her favorite due to the sandlewood she picked up. I personally only pick up a faint dose of coffee but it is blended extremely smoothly as a whole. Both men and woman can wear this while smelling unique as not everyone has this fragrance due to its price point. <br />
<br />
The first time I wore this my mom stopped in her tracks and begged to know what this was. The fragrance stuck to her body after a hug and she was smelling her arms all evening long (seriously.) <br />
I first received a sample before buying and after smelling the sample I knew this had to be my first Bond No. 9 fragrance.<br />
<br />
Best suited for evenings, dates, special occasions, or cool weather.<br />
Overall 5/5</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="1912322"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=1912322#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1892589" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1892589" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Charmedbymeghan"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1736880"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Charmedbymeghan" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1892589ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1892589" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1736880">Charmedbymeghan</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-02">08/02/23 10:28</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>First Impression: <br />
<br />
I just received my 10mL decant of this and very excited to try it - I gave 3 good sprays to my hand... <br />
<br />
The first 5 minutes are giving me Very Familiar Vibes... I am getting cotton candy perfume...  reminding me of something that could be in Ariana Grande's line up (only stronger)... Cloud &amp; Cloud 2.0 specifically come to mind.  Also Skylar's Boardwalk Delight.  I own all 3.  And while at this point NYN smells stronger and well done, it does not smell unique.  <br />
<br />
As we move past 15-20 minutes it is changing though... I am getting a Grandma note + cotton candy lol.  Maybe it is just something my Grams used to wear when I was younger so now I associate that smell to her*...  <br />
<br />
The cotton candy is fading off more, the Grandma note is moving on in...<br />
<br />
I am not getting caramel or coffee.  I am getting a general soft (kind of edible) sweetness with a marine touch.  And the scent is not Ariana Grande anymore, nor cotton candy.  It's gotten much lighter as it settles in.  But it's still noticeable.  <br />
<br />
Overall this isn't what I want to smell like.  The beginning was nice, nothing special in my collection though.  And almost too strong for that type of fragrance.  Cotton Candy types smell better being a little more airy.  But that fades off within 20 minutes or so anyways, to something else completely.  Definitely not modern smelling imo.  Becomes basic even?  This is a pass for me (The 90's called and they want their fragrance back :/ )   <br />
<br />
I will keep trying this though and if I change my mind completely will update.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="1892589"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=1892589#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1888463" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1888463" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="timmybils"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1773009"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1773009.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="timmybils" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/SpongeBob-Squarepants/Squidward-28290.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.28290.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Squidward"title="Squidward"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1888463ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1888463" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1773009">timmybils</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-07-27">07/27/23 15:53</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>THIS... is really amazing. White floral, blended masterfully</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="1888463"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=1888463#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1885675" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1885675" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Darokes85"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1293316"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1293316.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Darokes85" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/Gentle-Fluidity-Silver-53400.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.53400.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Gentle Fluidity Silver"title="Gentle Fluidity Silver"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1885675ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1885675" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1293316">Darokes85</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-07-24">07/24/23 03:00</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Based off reviews, I was expecting a warm sexy caramel and coffee gourmand with some floral and marine *touches* but I mostly get patchouli. A big heaping dose of patchouli, with a vague sweet gourmand facet. I dont get caramel or coffee, just patchouli with a dessert like sweetness. It kind of smells like tanning oil. I feel deceived</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="1885675"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=1885675#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1885360" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1885360" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="sarahxcx"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1378184"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="sarahxcx" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1885360ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1885360" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1378184">sarahxcx</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-07-23">07/23/23 14:02</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This perfume is SO GOOD. It's definitely unique, it is NOT a blind buy, and it's very hard to describe in words. But I'll try lol - this is one of my favorite true unisex perfumes. Anyone of any gender can wear this, and that's rare to find despite so many scents being marketed as "unisex." I get the banana smell a lot of other people pick up on, and it made me really skeptical at first. But I swear it's not a tacky or tropical banana. It's more like an "accidental" banana that's a result of the combination of notes on initial spray. This starts out very fresh, floral, and sweet - for the first 30 minutes it smells like a salted caramel and banana sundae you're eating by the beach, next to a wild bush blooming with flowers. It's gorgeous. After a little bit, it turns more masculine and it's a woody, aquatic scent with some florals in there that keeps it from being straight-up men's cologne. And after a few hours it settles into a warm, salty caramel that's so delicious. I don't get any coffee from this. The strongest notes (to my nose) are the florals, banana, sandalwood, aquatic note and caramel. There really isn't any patchouli or coffee, and if you're hoping to buy this and smell those notes, I'd say skip it. It's so interesting and different, and the notes play out exactly the way they should in expensive perfume. It smells more feminine on clothes and stays fresh, floral and sweet on clothing (doesn't change like it does on your skin) which is something to note. But again, anyone can wear this. I'm obsessed with this and I'm so glad I bought it during the summer, it's one of those warm gourmands that work really well in the heat. Get a sample of this and try it if you like gourmands, are looking for something really different, and you don't mind standing out with your perfume.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="1885360"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=1885360#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1880999" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1880999" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="R.diggity"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1781669"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1781669.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="R.diggity" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Banana-Republic/Grassland-64021.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.64021.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Grassland"title="Grassland"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1880999ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1880999" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1781669">R.diggity</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-07-17">07/17/23 17:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I normally dont go for gooey sweet smells, and I hate anything banana-ish.  But oh my God this settles in soooo good.<br />
<br />
Reading patchouli and sandalwood as ingredients, I was scared how it would play out with the caramelized powerful scent.<br />
<br />
But this works so well.  I really cant explain it.  If you like super unique unisex perfumes like Initio or Replicathis is a no brainer and you will stand out without dry humping everyones nose around you.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="1880999"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=1880999#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1868924" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
