align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="1731045"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=1731045#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1728067" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:4,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1728067" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="jayznar"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1320635"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1320635.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="jayznar" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1728067ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1728067" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1320635">jayznar</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-01-07">01/07/23 18:12</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Yeah... a big no for me. The banana-ish smell is there, definitely a sweet fragrance. But the carnation, patchouli and sea notes ARE PRESENT and create such a piercing, quality that I do not think people are mentioning. It is really hard to describe but it smells like a really stinky cologne that an older uncle would wear in the early 2000s mixed with bananas. I wore it once from a sample and it was unbelievablely strong, annoying &amp; nausea-inducing. This could have been something better, but my skin rejected this I think.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="1728067"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=1728067#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1713035" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1713035" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Zactel"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1460903"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1460903.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Zactel" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1713035ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1713035" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1460903">Zactel</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-12-19">12/19/22 17:52</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Smells really good, smells honestly like bananas. But in a very good way. I would say this leans very much towards women as it is very gourmand. Performance on my skin isnt the best. One of the more unique scents from bond no 9.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="1713035"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=1713035#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1708012" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1708012" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Vannamae__"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1236771"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1236771.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Vannamae__" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/FZOTIC/Lilac-Brulee-100540.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.100540.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Lilac Brle"title="Lilac Brle"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1708012ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1708012" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1236771">Vannamae__</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-12-12">12/12/22 20:06</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I don't like being so negative but I hate this, the first blast is straight up nail polish remover. Albeit the best smelling nail polish remover but still. It gets a little sweeter like banana bread as it dries down but I can still smell that acetone like quality and its really off putting honestly. A marine note joins the party and makes it even worse. I would not feel comfortable wearing this out in public so Im glad I tried it at home. <br />
<br />
Im not a fan of this house so take this review for what you will but I keep thinking Ill find one I love but Im always so put off by their dna I guess. Its not refined to me at all and I expect refined for the prices they charge. If they were cheaper Id judge less harshly. A respected long time fragrance reviewer once said many years ago that he doesnt review bond fragrances because he thinks they are a mess of a house and at that time I hadnt smelled enough of them to know if I felt the same but I honestly have to agree now with that statement with the 20 or so Ive tried. Why I keep trying I dont know but Ive tried enough now I feel to make my own conclusions. They feel like they are trying to be more upscale than they are. Charging a lot for very synthetic scents. Thats  just my opinion, if you love it more power to you! :) I just wish I got what others got from this scent because I dont understand the hype. I want the banana bread caramel gourmand I get hints of without the acetone please lol.<br />
<br />
Longevity was poor thankfully in my case but the first spray was STRONG and remained so for about 2 hours before going into a skin scent.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="1708012"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=1708012#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1705796" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1705796" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Chikobowoski"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1296357"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1296357.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Chikobowoski" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/By-Kilian/Black-Phantom-43632.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.43632.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Black Phantom"title="Black Phantom"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1705796ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1705796" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1296357">Chikobowoski</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-12-09">12/09/22 18:18</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Being my first Bond I'm in love with this one. Definitely a gourmand scent and I pick up a lot of the caramel note, but can see why some many people get the banana-esque feel and I enjoy that despite my hatred of bananas. Doesn't last long on my skin (~2 hours) normally even with my lotion routine, but when I combined with a body oil, it's there to stay and haunt me throughout the day. Definitely a cold weather scent and true to the name best worn in the evenings, but is mildly sweet and non-offensive that I can pull it off around the office during the daytime.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="1705796"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=1705796#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1696419" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1696419" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ss1122"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1584535"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1584535.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ss1122" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Xerjoff/Apollonia-55970.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.55970.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Apollonia"title="Apollonia"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1696419ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1696419" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1584535">ss1122</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-11-26">11/26/22 08:03</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Rarely do I fall in love with a fragrance on the first spray. But New York Nights just works with my body chemistry in a beautiful way. Yes I get the banana vibe but its the best subtle caramel cacao banana vibe youve ever smelled. My husband, who rarely can even smell my perfume no matter how strong, said immediately this was such a beautiful fragrance and how much he loved it. I sprayed before bed and the next morning I could still smell it. Projection is moderate, but this is definitely signature scent worthy for me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="1696419"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=1696419#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1689869" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1689869" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="eau de dosa"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1313456"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1313456.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="eau de dosa" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1689869ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1689869" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1313456">eau de dosa</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-11-16">11/16/22 13:58</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Banana laffy taffy with caramel and flowers. Smells yummy. Almost banana bread but then the florals kick in. Sexy night time scent.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="1689869"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=1689869#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1689204" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1689204" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Elle&#039;s Bells"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1466853"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1466853.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Elle&#039;s Bells" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Yves-Saint-Laurent/Caban-32267.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.32267.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Caban"title="Caban"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1689204ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1689204" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1466853">Elle&#039;s Bells</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-11-15">11/15/22 17:57</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Wait a minute...Where's the caramel? Where's the beautiful coffee note? I'm so confused by this fragrance! Damn, I was anticipating that ooey, gooey caramel note that so many YT'bers were raving about. This fragrance pulls floral and sweet with an obvious aquatic note. Is it beautiful-YES!!! Would I call it a gourmand??? NO!!! I will put my bottle away for now and bring it back out in the Spring. Le Sigh.......</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="1689204"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=1689204#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1686119" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1686119" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Korra13"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1585881"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1585881.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Korra13" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1686119ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1686119" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1585881">Korra13</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-11-11">11/11/22 11:02</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I expected this to be much more gourmand than it pulled on me. It is very floral on me, but in a soft, understated way. All in all, it is a beautiful fragrance but at an exorbitant price point for what it is, at least for me. I was hoping for a heavy caramel and coffee scent so I was disappointed after hearing a few rave reviews about this being one of the best gourmands and that not being my experience with it at all.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="1686119"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=1686119#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1685135" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1685135" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="SailorV"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/955817"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.955817.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="SailorV" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1685135ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1685135" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/955817">SailorV</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-11-10">11/10/22 03:04</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Coffee, caramel and the countless mentions of an unlisted banana note in the reviews drew me in to try this. And yeah, I'm not disappointed, that's exactly what I get here! <br />
Surprisingly this reminds me a lot of Rihanna's Rebelle, which is one of my favorite celebrity fragrances of all time and can keep up with many more expensive releases. Both have the same creamy, bittersweet coffee and dark chocolate scent. Rebelle has a cacao note, New York Nights doesn't, but it still smells like it had one to me. It might just be the sweetened patchouli they both have. <br />
The main difference is that Rebelle has a red fruity accord, while NYN has that phantom banana note and a salty sea breeze wafting through the scent. I'm a bit confused about all the florals in the notes list, this doesn't smell floral at all to me. As white florals can sometimes have a banana vibe, I suppose that this is what happens here, too.<br />
<br />
All in all this reminds me of a frothy dark mocha with a caramelized banana on the side, both drizzled with thick swirls of dark chocolate sauce, served by the seaside. The patchouli and sandalwood in the base make it smell like a real perfume though. Even though I mentioned banana a few times, don't go for this if you're looking for a dominant true to life banana scent - the banana is just one small part of this, coffee, caramel and patch are the most important notes here.<br />
<br />
True to the name this would be nice for nights out (not sure about New York, I haven't been there yet), but I think it would also work nicely on colder days.<br />
<br />
It's a great scent that I would happily wear if it just appeared in my cupboard out of the blue. I wouldn't buy it for 300+ when Rebelle is still available for a tenth of that or less though.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="1685135"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=1685135#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1682157" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1682157" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="coffeebean83"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1560657"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1560657.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="coffeebean83" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1682157ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1682157" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1560657">coffeebean83</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-11-06">11/06/22 01:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a difficult fragrance imo.   It's unisex but for me leans more toward the male side.   I liked it much more initially than I do now.  I get the banana bread with a touch of caramel but I grew to understand how it comes across as a bit of a chemically nail polish remover scent also.   It's twisted that It can smell like both. lol  It's a very warm cool weather scent.   I like it but am conflicted on it at the same time.  I'll just say I'm undecided on where this falls for me and give it a "ok" vote for now.   This is one you need to get a decant of and really try out for a while before buying.   Good longevity(8-12 hrs) but I don't think it projects hugely.   It's fairly strong at close proximity.   We'll see how it does in very cold weather in Dec-Feb....I'm hoping and could see that being a good time for this scent.<br />
<br />
Edited to add:  Gifted this to a male family member.  I just couldn't get with the overall chemical undertone.  And to be honest I think this smells better on men.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="1682157"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=1682157#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1678754" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1678754" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Moonshine_Strawberries"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1446987"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1446987.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Moonshine_Strawberries" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Memo-Paris/Madurai-75181.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.75181.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Madurai"title="Madurai"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1678754ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1678754" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1446987">Moonshine_Strawberries</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-11-01">11/01/22 12:37</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I come back to this sample once in a great while but lately more often because its suddenly growing on me. I disagree with it being excessively sweet or gourmand, but everyone is different. To me it doesnt really smell like the notes listed but I dont know what it DOES smell like. I find it very interesting but without sacrificing being really nice for the uniqueness. I can see the banana when its mentioned but vaguely and never would have thought about it if I hadnt read reviews. This just seems to get a lot of flak so I just wanted to put my two cents in. To be fair, Id probably only buy it in knock off form since its so expensive and not an absolute top favorite.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="1678754"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=1678754#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1675671" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1675671" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="KerriZ"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1506615"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1506615.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="KerriZ" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1675671ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1675671" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1506615">KerriZ</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-10-27">10/27/22 16:59</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Very Carmely and vanilla, long lasting and Super sweet. Not my thing, but if you like gourmands this is a good one.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="1675671"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=1675671#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1669835" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1669835" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="liebe_anne"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1504903"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1504903.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="liebe_anne" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1669835ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1669835" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1504903">liebe_anne</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-10-19">10/19/22 17:43</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I read the reviews after purchasing it and on the opening, I dont get the banana smell but rather it smells like nail polish or walking into a nail salon. Am I the only one getting this?? I do smell the coffee in the dry down though but its still very sweet and Im not sure if thats the sandalwood or the patchouli Im getting. Theres a little bit of caramel too but its too light to make this a gourmand fragrance for me. Not worth the price tag for me sadly and Im unsure if Ill keep this bottle in my collection but for now Ill keep testing it out.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="1669835"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=1669835#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1667098" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1667098" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="jassca99"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/614231"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.614231.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="jassca99" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1667098ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1667098" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/614231">jassca99</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-10-16">10/16/22 01:17</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Ylang in gold by M. Micallef but actually dialed back with less sweetness, coconut, vanilla, projection and longevity. Both still linked by the banana custard scent profile. If Ylang in Gold didnt work outside of just summer or vacations, I would say New York nights is perfect for everyday wear outside of summer. It is very beautiful. However, it isnt strong or impactful enough for night outs, let alone a NY night ironically. Maybe for date nights and a night in ;). Luckily YIG is versatile enough to not need another similar fragrance, like this one, in my collection. So if you have one, you dont need the other and vice versa.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="1667098"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=1667098#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1662309" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1662309" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Nataliemarie"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/273464"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.273464.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Nataliemarie" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Thomas-Kosmala/Apres-l-Amour-53742.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.53742.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Aprs lAmour"title="Aprs lAmour"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1662309ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1662309" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/273464">Nataliemarie</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-10-09">10/09/22 06:31</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Banana Latte. Verrry Light, I wish it was a little stronger. I do not return often, but I think I'm going to. I feel like I need 1/4 of the bottle on to get what I need.  This gets incensey towards the drydown. It is well blended, hard to pick out exact notes. Light Patchouli if you are afraid of that. I will update if I end up keeping it. I get Organza Indecence vibes. This does NOT smell like Demeter's Banana Flambee. I have repurchased that for YEARS &amp; I LOVE that one, it doesn't last long tho.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="1662309"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=1662309#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1659707" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; It smells like runtz banana candy when first sprayed but then it turns into a yummy fresh baked banana bread scent.  Dry down i only smell patchouli. It kinda smells like a gourmand Tom ford black orchid, prob due to the patchouli.  I wish it smelled more like caramel than banana and patchouli, but its still a delicious scent.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="1659707"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=1659707#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1646265" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; I get the faintest hint of gardenia that works nicely with the caramel. NYN seems to be a novelty type of fragrance. It reminds me of the caramel heavy Sol de Jainero scents but with less out of place chemicals. You can smell the quality in the ingredients, but I can't imagine wearing this for more than a day.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="1646265"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=1646265#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1644871" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Looking to buy a bottle in the US</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="1629463"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=1629463#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1627317" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1627317" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="krayolakolorz"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/340083"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.340083.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="krayolakolorz" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.46057.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="New York Nights"title="New York Nights"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1627317ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1627317" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/340083">krayolakolorz</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-08-19">08/19/22 18:58</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This really reminds me of Lolita Lempika levels of sweet delicious oddity, this is such a interesting scent. I kept smelling it over and over, Ive never ever smelled anything like this before, and I just adore it! Anything different, alien, odd, or out of the norm Im going to go straight for, and this scent is one of them. <br />
<br />
The notes are correct in the scenting category, even though I would move the sandalwood to (dare I say) a top note? Move gardenia mid or even base. Lots of commentary about this being a "banana milkshake" smell. I wouldn't have guessed this until I read a few reviews about it, and now im able identify it, pretty spot on.<br />
<br />
However I cast my vote for banana laffy taffy (essentially the same thing?) minus the milk, I dont get a "creamy" vibe from this one due to the high carnelian top note. Still....I love smelling like a candied snack, just saying!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="1627317"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=1627317#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1625242" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1625242" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Starlight"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1264570"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1264570.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Starlight" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Montale/Vanille-Absolu-4064.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4064.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Vanille Absolu"title="Vanille Absolu"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1625242ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1625242" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1264570">Starlight</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-08-17">08/17/22 00:13</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Sickly sweet, to the point of nauseating in my opinion. It would be better blended with oud or a vodka base to take that sickly banana/caramel with marine notes that do not mix that well for me.<br />
 It's like having liqueur cocktails without the liquor when it really needs a base note.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="1625242"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=1625242#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1618210" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1609310" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ohsnapamb"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1392523"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="ohsnapamb" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1609310ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1609310" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1392523">ohsnapamb</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-07-23">07/23/22 19:20</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I do get the banana vibes others are getting. Its definitely unique in my collection and I love it. I recently tried a sample of Tribeca from bond no 9, which reminds me of a creamier baccarat rouge 540. I decided to mix New York Nights with BR540 and Im in love.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="1609310"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=1609310#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1599929" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1599929" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Miss.Tara"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/785204"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.785204.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Miss.Tara" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Victoria-s-Secret/Tease-Sugar-Fleur-76967.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.76967.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Tease Sugar Fleur"title="Tease Sugar Fleur"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1599929ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1599929" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/785204">Miss.Tara</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-07-09">07/09/22 17:02</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I could see this being a signature fragrance that is perfect for everyday. Not because it's not offensive or easy to wear, which it is, but because it's so unique and addictive. From the notes and peoples' reviews, it sounds dripping sweet, but it's not. It's a perfect blend that lasts and last without being bombastic or fill a room when you walk in. I wouldn't have guessed banana unless I read it. Of course now that I know, I can identify it, but it's one piece of the big picture.<br />
I'm curious why so many voted overpriced? I mean, $200USD+ for a fragrance regardless of what it smells like is pretty steep when there are many out there for 50-100USD. But I've never smelled THIS. There are A LOT of fakes out there, I can't help but think people that are comparing this to a demeter frag either has a fake, or sprayed this on paper and immediately smelled it and summed it up in 3 seconds. <br />
I don't know what this smells like on paper, but on skin and clothes it's absolutely satisfying any season day or night. Maybe not 100F or 37C. <br />
This would be incredible on a guy too, sometimes the combo of notes trick me into thinking there is a ribbon of smooth pipe tobacco wafting around andve it!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="1599929"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=1599929#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1596792" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1594345" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ashtonanders"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1527570"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1527570.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ashtonanders" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Versace/Eros-16657.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.16657.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Eros"title="Eros"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1594345ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1594345" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.87);
