I initially smelt it from my older cousin. As soon as it hit me I had to ask her "What are you wearing its delicious!" she told me it was an expensive perfume and my mom and I immediately bought samples as soon as we got home from the family function. It is my signature scent and I've only gotten compliments on it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="1594345"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=1594345#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1589554" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1589554" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="jlfears"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1222526"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1222526.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="jlfears" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Adam-Levine/Adam-Levine-for-Women-17490.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.17490.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Adam Levine for Women"title="Adam Levine for Women"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1589554ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1589554" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1222526">jlfears</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-06-22">06/22/22 16:09</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is my new obsession.   <br />
<br />
The notes make you think it would be heavy.  Its long lasting, but somehow sheer.  <br />
<br />
I get the banana milkshake. Its lightly spiced.  It doesnt smell ozonic and it doesnt smell like seaweed and it doesnt smell aquatic, but somehow it feels like the beach at night.  There is a fresh note thats done so well that 1. you cant pinpoint it and 2. it works with the other deeper notes.  <br />
<br />
Very well blended. <br />
<br />
Of the notes listed, I get these, in no particular order:<br />
<br />
Gardenia (but sheeeeeer and creamy)<br />
Sea Notes<br />
Caramel and Coffee (but barely there, more of an impression)<br />
<br />
Notes I smell that arent there:<br />
<br />
Banana milkshake <br />
<br />
The same spice Indian restaurants often use in their rice pudding.  <br />
<br />
HUGE love.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="1589554"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=1589554#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1585313" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1585313" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Sv0b0da"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1520850"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Sv0b0da" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1585313ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1585313" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1520850">Sv0b0da</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-06-15">06/15/22 23:34</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is by far my favorite Bond fragrance, and possibly my all time favorite of hundreds of fragrances smelled. It gives my wife goosebumps. Its sweet, sexy, and strange, deep, dark, brooding, transporting. Caramel, banana bread, and a floral note with a sharp, ghostly spiciness that imparts the sense of a sour bite, without actually smelling sour. The sour vibes balance the super sweet notes. Im a man and I wear this daily. A woman of any age could pull it off. Go smell Ariana Grande Cloud at Ulta. If you like it, but want something much more refined, complex, and more unisex, just blind buy this. You need to be a certain kind of man to wear this. Its not for someone ultra manly, but you need to have some manliness to spare to sell this as a mens fragrance. Its a strange, dark smell, so who you are as a person will play a role in how well this fits you.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="1585313"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=1585313#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1583423" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1583423" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="allthatis_barelythere"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1485149"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1485149.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="allthatis_barelythere" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1583423ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1583423" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1485149">allthatis_barelythere</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-06-13">06/13/22 02:51</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>When I was sampling this, Id sometimes like the sweet caramel and coffee coming through. Its quite interesting and complex. But then I get whiffs of another side that I dont really like I cant really decide how I feel about it. Its like the floral side and gourmand side are competing for attention. A lot of reviews mention banana bread &amp; TF Black Orchid - I think I agree. I wasnt sure whether to rate it okay or dislike but went with the latter, purely based on how much I dislike the bottle</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="1583423"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=1583423#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1575099" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1575099" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="CrissyCK"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1388879"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1388879.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="CrissyCK" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Le-Labo/Another-13-10131.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.10131.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Another 13"title="Another 13"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1575099ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1575099" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1388879">CrissyCK</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-05-31">05/31/22 19:51</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a unique scent, and definitely a summer frag. Its oceanic, and smells summery no coconut but the caramel and coffee replace it as gourmand. Long-lasting. <br />
<br />
I initially noticed the runtz scent spoken about but I dont notice that anymore. <br />
<br />
Keeper in my collection!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="1575099"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=1575099#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1566162" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1566162" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="nbazza"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1379491"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="nbazza" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1566162ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1566162" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1379491">nbazza</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-05-18">05/18/22 03:09</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Sooo yummy for the gourmand and caramel lovers. For the caramel fragrances I own there is usually a citrus note accompanied, but this is unique in that you smell the coffee and the sea notes. I'm not sure if it smells $400, maybe it smells as if it's 30% off $400, but a great scent. Oh yes. it smells like a sweet banana too and kind of like a yankee candle!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="1566162"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=1566162#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1545897" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1545897" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Zoisite75"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1318571"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Zoisite75" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Carolina-Herrera/Good-Girl-Fantastic-Pink-58923.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.58923.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Good Girl Fantastic Pink"title="Good Girl Fantastic Pink"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1545897ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1545897" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1318571">Zoisite75</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-04-18">04/18/22 10:37</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I am always surprised how differently people experience fragrances. I blind bought this due to the rave reviews about what a great gourmand this is supposed to be and because I think it is the most beautiful Bond No. 9 bottle. I was even planning on getting the expensive bejeweled one at some point, that was before I smelled it. I guess it is a nice gourmand but it smells so, so masculine to me. Yes I also think anyone can wear anything. And I do like unisex fragrances, but this smells similar to many, many other fragrances that are marketed specifically towards men. I know as a women who gravitates towards more girlie fragrances, I cannot pull it off and I hope others who are about to purchase it try a sample first. I have a lot of fragrances and this to me heavily leans masculine. However, looking at other reviews I am clearly in the tiny minority. And the bottle wow is just amazing.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="1545897"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=1545897#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1530521" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1530521" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Cyllde"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1312369"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1312369.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Cyllde" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1530521ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1530521" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1312369">Cyllde</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-03-25">03/25/22 19:07</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I don't tend to love unisex scents unless they lean feminine. This leans a bit masculine in the overall performance. The start is nice. A bit gourmand even tho the caramel is in the base I was picking it up immediately. The coffee note however is too dark for me. It's like burnt dark roast/cafe mocha and I think that's what turns this into a masculine vibe. It's something I would like to smell on a man but not myself.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="1530521"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=1530521#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1512035" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Lot's of compliments, amazing dry down. Fall, winter scent but I'll also try this out in the evenings.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="1512035"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=1512035#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1510119" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Imagine the best banana bread you've ever smelled. This is coming from a person that doesn't really like gourmand fragrances. Smells good enough to drink. <br />
<br />
Scent 9/10<br />
Performance 7.5/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="1510119"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=1510119#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1498298" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1119516">jelder_2007</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-02-05">02/05/22 12:10</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Smells like by the fireplace in the dry down</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1496830" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Sweetasgodiva"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1362715"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1362715.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Sweetasgodiva" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Xerjoff/La-Capitale-55782.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.55782.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="La Capitale"title="La Capitale"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1496830ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1496830" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.74); I think I detect the marine not which I imagine is used to cut the sweetness. I like it but am not swept away but I will see how it fares throughout the day!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="1496830"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=1496830#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1489269" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; I can explain easily but it is very unique and not overbearing. I absolutely love it and would recommend! Very well packaged</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="1489269"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=1489269#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1489260" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1489260" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Qortni"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1338106"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1338106.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Qortni" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Yves-Saint-Laurent/24-rue-de-l-Universite-47671.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.47671.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="24 rue de l'Universit"title="24 rue de l'Universit"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1489260ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck7x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1489260" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1338106">Qortni</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-01-23">01/23/22 09:54</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Picture this, if you will: <br />
<br />
A home is filled with the smell of banana nut bread, made earlier in the day - now cooled down into a dense and moist treat.  Coffee's brewing.  The window is open, and clean tropical air is carrying in flowers from the garden.  Rain is coming.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="1489260"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=1489260#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1476453" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1476453" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Whit"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/57880"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.57880.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Whit" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1476453ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1476453" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/57880">Whit</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-01-04">01/04/22 19:42</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>At first, I get the banana runtz that everyone keeps talkling about. Then it dries to more of a banana wafer pudding drizzled with caramel and a coffee nearby. I don't get any of the floral or marine notes on my skin, but I do get the patchouli which gives an earthy-gourmand feel. I love gourmands, but I can say that this isn't sugary sweet. It's creamy and perfectly unisex. Great for fall, winter, and cold spring days. Delicious without being too sweet, but sweet enough for a gourmand lover.<br />
<br />
Update: sillage is moderate with this one but longevity was great. I kept keeping wafts throughout the day and it stuck to my clothing even though I don't spray my clothes. Very nice!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="1476453"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=1476453#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1473420" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1451577" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Chantiniiii"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1362613"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1362613.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Chantiniiii" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Phlur/Not-Your-Baby-73292.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.73292.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Not Your Baby"title="Not Your Baby"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1451577ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1451577" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1362613">Chantiniiii</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-11-24">11/24/21 11:19</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Okay so hear me out.. This smells exactly like Tom Fords Black Orchid with an added banana note. I actually love how creamy and smooth it is. I get really good longevity from it as well, about 8+ hours.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="1451577"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=1451577#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1443052" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1443052" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Swedelish"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1128461"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1128461.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Swedelish" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Chanel/Chance-Eau-Tendre-8069.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.8069.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Chance Eau Tendre"title="Chance Eau Tendre"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1443052ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1443052" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1128461">Swedelish</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-11-09">11/09/21 14:28</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I like it! The scent is a little bit odd in a good way and I can't pinpoint anything else it smells like, but it does reminds me of older (pre 2010's) Bond gourmands. The DNA is there and if I was blindfolded I'd probably guess it was an older  Bond No 9. I'm thinking ILNYF All, Nuits De Noho, New Haarlem, Lexington Avenue. None of these smell alike, but the way in which the ingredients are blended and the balance of caramel and coffee here against the woods and florals is a common theme for this house. Unlike Tribeca, which was a departure from their usual style and not in a good way (ambroxan, I'm looking at you) , New York Nights embodies what I love about this house. It isn't trying to be trendy, it's not overly complex, and it's different from anything I've smelled. I had my husband, a non-fragrance enthusiast, try it and he wasn't a fan of it for himself, but a man with a diversified palate who likes floral woody-gourmands might like it. I will be enjoying it quite a bit this season, which is great because I blind bought a 100 ml. <br />
<br />
As for the scent itself, I see what people mean when they talk about banana. It does have an oddly satisfying banana custardy thing going on with caramel drizzle on top, and a backdrop of woods. I get a tiny cinnamon-y hit in the opening, very faint. Little to no sea notes but I'm sure they're what help balance the gourmand /woody/patchouli notes and keep it from being too sweet. Gardenia adds a touch of white floral butteriness which makes the scent rich and Plush. The coffee is hard to find under the richness of the other notes. Maybe a tiny bit later on as it dries down. It's linear, more feminine than male imo, and best for cool Temps. The scent kinda does smell deep blue like the bottle.   Longevity is average, as is projection. <br />
<br />
A big like, but not my favorite from the brand. It's a bit of a moody one for me. Sometimes it feels right, sometimes not. I haven't pinned down why. There's something in the notes that doesn't always sit well with me, though it's never actually bothersome. When I'm feeling it though, I really really enjoy it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="1443052"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=1443052#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1440050" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1192461">SalinasL</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-11-04">11/04/21 11:45</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Weird, this smells exactly like the classic ChapStick brand of lip balm, which happens to be a scent that I dont like and which gives me a headache. I think the flavour of that is meant to be cherry (but cant say it smells recognizably like cherry). Im completely bewildered, as I dont see anything listed here that would account for it. It does not smell gourmand at all on my skinno caramel/coffee, I dont detect any flower or even the patchouli. Ive tried it a few times now (from a carded sample) and Ive had to scrub it off every time. Oh well, cant afford it anyway!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="1440050"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=1440050#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1422325" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1388633">ScentsAppeal</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-10-01">10/01/21 17:48</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A gourmand lovers dream. This was a blind buy for me after reading reviews here and watching ones on YouTube. Took a risk but I couldnt be more pleased. Perfect fall/winter fragrance. Comforting, sweet, warm and inviting. Any floral aspect for me dissipates rather quickly then shifts directly into gourmand mode, where it remains.  In addition to the caramel/coffee I also get the banana that others have commented on, but it works! I have several Bond fragrances. This is my new favourite.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="1420501"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=1420501#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1418816" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1418816" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="e2less"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1290667"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1290667.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="e2less" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Nishane/Nanshe-64093.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.64093.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Nanshe"title="Nanshe"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1418816ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1418816" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.78); The notes are blended to perfection. The caramel coffee base has a fruity background. The florals and sandalwood dry down  comes in hours later. Definitely on full bottle worthy buy waiting on a store promo for bond no 9. Too pricey for now!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="1418816"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=1418816#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1418611" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1415745" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="SwatchQueen"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1332796"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1332796.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="SwatchQueen" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Fragrance-Du-Bois/Santal-Complet-41677.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.41677.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Santal Complet"title="Santal Complet"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1415745ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1415745" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1332796">SwatchQueen</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-09-23">09/23/21 12:22</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I smell the banana too! Like Banana Parfait or Banana Runtz. I love this fragrance so much, I am addicted since I got it. My husband do not smell banana he smells Caramel Latte and flowers. Such a good smooth blend. A must try from Bond No 9 especially if you are a gourmand lover. <br />
<br />
This lasts 4 hours on my skin and I have to respray but I do not mind at all. It lasts longer on the clothing, it is eternal on my clothes. <br />
<br />
10/10 for me! My favourite from Bond are Greenwich Village, Tribeca and this one New York Nights. Quite unique and beautiful!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="1415745"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=1415745#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1401445" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1401445" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="LisaandtheWord"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/25188"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.25188.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="LisaandtheWord" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Yves-Rocher/Voile-d-Ambre-1981.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1981.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Voile d'Ambre"title="Voile d'Ambre"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1401445ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1401445" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/25188">LisaandtheWord</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-08-30">08/30/21 13:56</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I was excited to try this because I usually like the notes used here.. but I find there's a slight b.o./dusty funk flavor in the background. To my nose the combo of marine note, sandalwood, gardenia, coffee and caramel are not adding up to a good outcome.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="1401445"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=1401445#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1359053" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1359053" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="LateBloomer"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1164542"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1164542.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="LateBloomer" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Memo-Paris/Tamarindo-48286.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.48286.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Tamarindo"title="Tamarindo"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1359053ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1359053" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1164542">LateBloomer</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-06-12">06/12/21 20:19</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Caramel, coffee, chocolate, banana...I tried describing it to my friend and I said it sounds horrible but it is AMAZING. It's the banana that just slays me - not a scent I have ever considered or wanted in a perfume, but it is what makes this one special. Lasts for 9 or 10 hours on me and projection is good - not too strong - but people around me notice it. I wear it at night in hot and humid weather and it shimmers in the heat. My favorite Bond.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="1359053"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=1359053#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1345025" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1345025" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="brand0nton"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1340488"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="brand0nton" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1345025ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1345025" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.81); Granted, not as heavy as Pure Havane...  but still too heavy to be worn year round. Definitely a 65 degree and below type fragrance.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="1345025"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=1345025#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1336251" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1336251" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Joseebus"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1334273"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1334273.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Joseebus" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Guerlain/Tobacco-Honey-84518.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.84518.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Tobacco Honey"title="Tobacco Honey"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1336251ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1336251" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1334273">Joseebus</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-05-02">05/02/21 15:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Frustrating, because this is truly a delicious, unique scent. Caramel, gourmand explosion before settling into a beautiful, somewhat powdery, Juicy Fruit gum-like dream (I swear to me it smells kinda like Juicy Fruit gum!). The problem is that it lasts MAYBE 2-3 hours on my skin with projection for maybe the first 30 minutes. For 400 bucks a bottle, I better be leaving a trail down the street for at least half the day! A shame. If it lasted longer and projected better this would definitely be a signature fragrance contender.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="1336251"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=1336251#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1327590" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1292508" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ingeneuxo"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1280821"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1280821.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ingeneuxo" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Byredo/Rose-Of-No-Man-s-Land-31931.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.31931.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Rose Of No Man's Land"title="Rose Of No Man's Land"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1292508ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1292508" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1280821">ingeneuxo</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-02-14">02/14/21 07:54</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>-Caramel-heavy gourmand.<br />
-The way caramel and patchouli is blended in this one creates a ghost note of spices that stands out...not in a good way.<br />
-Light scent. Would probably would suffer issues with longevity.<br />
-Not fbw. (-)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="1292508"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=1292508#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1288811" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1288811" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Goldengoose"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1269082"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Goldengoose" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Amouage/Jubilation-XXV-Man-2366.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.2366.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Jubilation XXV Man"title="Jubilation XXV Man"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1288811ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1288811" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1269082">Goldengoose</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-02-07">02/07/21 19:36</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>sex scent</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="1288811"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=1288811#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1258074" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1258074" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="bourcet"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1090870"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1090870.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="bourcet" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Initio-Parfums-Prives/Rehab-50351.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.50351.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Rehab"title="Rehab"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1258074ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1258074" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1090870">bourcet</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-12-07">12/07/20 19:58</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I was ready to hate this one because it's Bond and that's what we do here on Fragrantica. The opening accords were typical of that Bond DNA meets the candy aisle; are these coffee-caramel-banana notes are evocative of...desserts at Eleven Madison Park? Serendipity II? A stoned run to Duane Reade for some Chunky Monkey? Whose New York Nights are these? Paula Deen's? I'm here for it, though. <br />
<br />
After the gourmand shit show dies down, this actually becomes an awesome scent. I didn't realize there was gardenia in this until I read the notes listed here; the gardenia is so dope when layered with these thick, syrupy accords! Seriously the only thing that can play down the stiff waxiness of a serious white floral like gardenia is some gourmand obscenity. It's like the equation gets balanced out by the opposite extremes: the staid, processional bridal flower with the fun raucousness of the reception and incipient chocolate fountain. Funereal carnation meets Bananas Foster! <br />
<br />
Whatever aquatic note pokes through during mid dry down is a bit weird but I feel like a lot of Bonds do this; ultimately it gives way to something really fun in the end. I think the overall emotions evoked from this fragrance is one of comfort, fun, and upbeat optimism. The perfect olfactory antidote for the dumpster fire that is 2020.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="1258074"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=1258074#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1246991" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1246991" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="aqua76239"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/19867"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.19867.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="aqua76239" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Gold-Coast-56778.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.56778.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Gold Coast"title="Gold Coast"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1246991ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1246991" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/19867">aqua76239</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-11-10">11/10/20 16:19</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A Bond SA suggested I try it and it was immediate like. This is creamy soft gourmand, and while most of their fragrances suggested as unisex, I can't picture this on a man. Its sweet but has a fresh note , I am guessing from sea notes accord, and caramel here is very smooth and smells like candy. Coffee usually a distinctive note but here its barely a hint and i picture more of frappuccino than actual black coffee.<br />
Gardenia listed as one of main notes but here I can't even smell it. Weird and weirder. For fairly soft scent it last pretty well. I sprayed one spray from tester at Bond counter and its been 3 hours and its still lingers on my skin. I think if you spray it several times, it will project well too. This goes on my want list. Probably for next year since i did quite a bit of damage those last couple of months.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="1246991"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=1246991#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1245988" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1245988" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="RottigrlNYC"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1191473"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1191473.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="RottigrlNYC" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1245988ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1245988" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1191473">RottigrlNYC</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-11-07">11/07/20 21:17</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>As all of the perfumes in this line, this one is also lite, boring and weak. You cant detect any of the notes, its so badly mixed.  After spraying myself 6 times I cant smell anything after 15mins .<br />
I have a bag full of Bond 9 samples I sampled and will never touch again. Bond #9 to me is a gimmicky house with perfumes that are all nothing special or even a lil bit interesting and no way are any of these worth the price they have the nerve to sell them for. I wouldnt pay more than $20 for these edt strength perfumes. Actually no, I wouldnt even want a Bond 9 for free. I have way too many beautiful and yummy smelling fragrances that Id much rather wear. Life is too short to wear boring weak crap perfumes. Boring perfumes are for boring ppl.  And THAT is my review. Honest as always. Unlike some ppl who are being paid to come here and lie.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46057"comment_id="1245988"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/New-York-Nights-46057.html?ccid=1245988#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1230195" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
